summary: Through the Hospital Value-based Purchasing program, hospitals that participate in Medicare receive bonuses or penalties, depending on their performance on a set of quality and efficiency measures. Despite the program's intention to reward hospitals that provide high-quality care at a lower cost, we found that some hospitals with low quality scores received bonuses because they had relatively high efficiency scores. title: Hospital Value-Based Purchasing: CMS Should Take Steps to Ensure Lower Quality Hospitals Do Not Qualify for Bonuses
